Canterbury earthquake memorial unveiling, six years on JACK FLETCHER AND SHAR DAVIS Last updated 12:20, February 22 2017 
The official unveiling of Christchurch's earthquake memorial is under way, six years after the magnitude-6.3 tragedy changed the city and its people forever. 
On February 22, 2011, 185 people were killed and buildings decimated. The unveiling of the official memorial for the victims began at 12pm on Wednesday. 
Oi Manawa , meaning "tremor of the heart", was designed by Slovenian architect Grega Vezjak. It is a 112.5-metre-long wall and is made of concrete, clad in Italian marble. It sits on the banks of the Avon River near the intersection of Montreal St and Oxford Tce. STACY SQUIRES/FAIRFAX NZ 
A cyclist takes a moment to take in the memorial wall. 
Strung around a nearby tree, notes to those who died dangle like petals, heartfelt words scrawled in many languages. 
​READ MORE:​ 
"Dear mum, I miss you so much, think about you every day," writes Marie. IAIN MCGREGOR/Stuff.co.nz 
Oi Manawa, the earthquake memorial dedicated to the 185 victims of the magnitude-6.3 earthquake that struck Christchurch on February 22, 2011, has opened to the public on the sixth anniversary of the tragedy. 
"Your two granddaughters miss you as well." 
On Wednesday morning, commuters on their way to work paused on the Montreal St bridge, looking out over the water to Oi Manawa, which details the victims' names over 40m of the wall. 
Breakfast 
Breakfast host Jack Tame found the name of his former cricket captain on the Memorial Wall. 
The wall was revealed to bereaved families and friends of victims at a private ceremony on Tuesday. 
Montreal St will be closed from Oxford Tce between 10am and 2.30pm, Cambridge Tce is closed until 6pm and Oxford Tce is closed until 2.30pm. MORNING REPORT/RNZ 
All but one of Christchurch's so called anchor projects will be under construction this year as the rebuild finally begins to hit its straps. STACY SQUIRES/FAIRFAX NZ 
Notes written to earthquake victim by their loved ones strung around a tree by the memorial. IAIN McGREGOR/FAIRFAX NZ 
A note for Matty Beaumont, who died in the CTV building, above his name on the memorial. It reads: "We think of you every day and miss you". IAIN McGREGOR/FAIRFAX NZ 
Bouquets left at the memorial, which is 112.5 metres long and made of concrete, clad in Italian marble. STACY SQUIRES/FAIRFAX NZ 
Early-morning sun at the CTV site on Wednesday. - Stuff
